newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Telkom pays 41.25 rph dividend for 1996.
newsitem.headline: Telkom pays 41.25 rph dividend for 1996.

text.p: Indonesian state-controlled telecommunications giant PT Telekomunikasi Indonesia (Telkom) said on Wednesday it would pay a dividend of 41.25 rupiah per share for 1996 against 24.48 rupiah for 1995.

"The dividend for 1996 is 41.25 rupiah per share," chairman of the board of commissioners Bambang Subianto said after the firm's shareholders approved the proposed dividend payment at the annual general meeting.
Subianto said Telkom posted a net profit of 1.5 trillion rupiah in 1996 against 906.9 billion rupiah in 1995.

As required by government regulations, the firm donated some two percent of the net profit, or around 22 billion rupiah, to the Dana Sejahtera Mandiri Foundation to help alleviate poverty, Subianto said.

Subianto said the total dividend amounted to 26 percent of net profits after the donation. Seventy-three percent will be used for investment with the remaining one percent to be kept in reserve, he said.
State-controlled Telkom is also listed in New York and London. -- Jakarta newsroom +6221 384-6364
